title: To The End Of A Dream
opening: The Imperial army arrives in Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital, only to be confronted by Rhea--who has transformed into the Immaculate One. The Black Eagle Strike Force steels itself for an epic final battle, hoping to soon return Fódlan to its people.

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: So, we have finally arrived. It has been a very, very long road.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Why are you here, Uncle? We haven't prevailed just yet.

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: Even better. I decided I wanted to see the end with my own eyes. The very moment that humans will finally be free from the control of that false beast of a goddess..

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Understood. Behold to your heart's content, just don't get in our way.

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: Of course. I could not stand to be dragged into the fighting. When this fight is over, a world completely controlled by the Empire will be upon us.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Not completely... I will only do what I must. But until our reign becomes stable... Uncle... No, all of you. I believe that your power and knowledge may be essential during that time of transition.

dialogue.speaker: Lord Arundel
dialogue.line: Perhaps so. We also will do what we must. For that short while, we will lend your our strength.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Yes... We're counting on you. For now.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Professor, may I speak with you?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What's on your mind?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I know the timing is less than ideal, but there's something I need to tell you. I imagine you've already sensed it, but even still... I must tell you the truth...of the power you wield and of what you are.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I have sensed it too.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I expected as much.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Have you still yet to realize it? If so, then it's absolutely vital that I tell you.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: You, like Rhea, share a bloodline with the so-called goddess. Your mother likely had some connection to the goddess, whose power has always been sleeping within you. Five years ago when your power awakened, I was afraid you would choose to join with Rhea.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You thought I would join her?

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I did.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Five years ago...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Yes. In the Sealed Forest, when you returned from the eternal darkness...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: As you know, my goal is to free our world from the control of Rhea and the other children of the goddess. I seek to obliterate her, as well as those around her who use the church's power to control Fódlan. I swore to free the people from Rhea by striking her down, whether or not it meant making an enemy of you. And yet...you came to my aid and chose to walk with me on the path against Rhea. I was overjoyed of course, but I was also confused. I thought that perhaps it wasn't the path you were meant to take. But I chose to trust in you, to rely on you and your strength. And now, here we are.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I understand...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Thank you for listening, my teacher. I'm glad I finally had the chance to talk to you about it.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Please explain it once more.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Of course...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: After Rhea is gone from this world, I don't know what will become of you. But whatever happens, I hope you know that you're very special to me. I hope that I hold a special place in your heart as well. But regardless...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: You are the one person in this world who can share the heavy burden I must carry. Someone without equal who I can always speak my mind to...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: It's time. Let's go, Professor.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Rhea! Members of the Church of Seiros! Surely there's no reason to continue this fight. What could possibly be gained by shutting yourselves inside the capital of a kingdom without a king? I will give you this one chance...and no other. Throw down your weapons and surrender! Unlike you, I have no desire to unleash wicked atrocities upon this world!

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Their silence speaks volumes. Shall we commence our attack?

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: I'll wait just a moment longer. There are still many residents within the city. Unlike my attack at Garreg Mach five years ago, the church will not allow the inhabitants to evacuate. What the hell are they planning...

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Lady Rhea...Or rather, Lady Seiros. The Imperial army is calling for our surrender. Is it wise to ignore them? Perhaps we could leave Fódlan and devise another plan...

intro.speaker: Seiros
intro.line: We shall not surrender. We must not lose! Even if it must split the heavens, we shall not yield to the wicked ones!

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Understood... I will do as you command. You have my fealty no matter what, until my last moment of life.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: I'll stay by your side too...forever.

intro.speaker: Seiros
intro.line: Now, Catherine. Set fire to the city. The Imperial army will burn in the flames of eternal torment!

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: What?! No, you can't do that!

intro.speaker: Seiros
intro.line: Catherine. Now.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: As...as you wish. But is there truly no other way?

intro.speaker: Seiros
intro.line: I have no patience for foolish questions. I shall sacrifice as many lives as it takes! That apostate who insists on taking everything from me...will by crushed by my own hands!

intro.speaker: The Immaculate One
intro.line: GRAAAARGH!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: That ghastly voice...

intro.speaker: Imperial Soldier
intro.line: Your Majesty! There's smoke coming from every corner of the capital! It seems they've set fire to the city!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: What?! Damn it, Rhea. There really is no depth you wouldn't sink into. Everyone, we must commence our attack at once. Are you ready?

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Preparations are complete. Just say the word.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Then we attack. We'll head straight for the castle and strike down their leader--Rhea, that vile creature called the Immaculate One! This is the end of our long war. After this victory, Fódlan will finally be united and truly free! The capital we're about to invade is engulfed in flames. Do not rush to your deaths. Survive. Prevail. Do that and we'll witness the birth of a new world. I want to see it with all of you at my side. Understood?

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Of course. I will not fall and leave you without your protector. That you may live to see your dream to fruition... For that, I shall survive and prevail!

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: I am carrying the future of Brigid. I will not be dying here! I will be winning. For myself and everyone, I will be surviving!

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: We've been cutting our own path this whole way. There's no stopping until we reach the end! I can't die, or all my great work so far will have been wasted!

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Don't worry about me, Edie. I won't fall before I've found my happily ever after. Maybe when this war is over I can finally snag a good catch and settle down!

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: Somehow we're already here... I wonder if the peace we secure will allow me to research as much as I'd like. If so, let's end this quickly!

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Edelgard! Professor! I'll do my best for both of you! If I die here, it would be with shame and regret... Oh, I can't let that happen!

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Once the world is united, I will lend my strength to both Edelgard and the Professor. To that end, I will lead us all safely to victory! My pride and duty as a noble demand no less! As do my own principles!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's win this, together!

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Imperial army! Black Eagle Strike Force! Move out!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: At last, we made it to Fhirdiad, but...it's in a pitiful state.

battle.speaker: Caspar
battle.line: It's so awful to see the Kingdom capital go up in flames, but at least we made it this far!

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: We finally stand before the palace. Though these flames will our friends and foes alike.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Those who stand in our way will perish with the flames. Immaculate One...your reign ends, here and now!

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: With fire raging all over the city, our enemies won't be able to advance in large numbers. Instead, they may try to defeat us with small squads of elite warriors.

battle.speaker: The Immaculate One
battle.line: Indeed, I suspect as much. And at their head is the one who stole my mother from me and likely that mutinous whelp, Edelgard.

battle.speaker: Bernadetta
battle.line: The whole city's burning! oh, this isn't good! I'm flammable, you know!

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: If possible, we must be avoiding the flame and be careful of strong enemies.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: If we want to minimize our losses, we will need to be flexible in our approach.

battle.speaker: The Immaculate One
battle.line: Open your hearts and accept your fate... The immaculate roar saves only the righteous! GRWOAAAAAARRRR!

battle.speaker: Linhardt
battle.line: What? Her howl as unadulterated magic. I didn't know such a display of power was possible.

battle.speaker: Ferdinand
battle.line: That roar seems to have affected the dolls' movements.

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: Whenever the Immaculate One howls, those dolls become stronger.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Such power resides in the Immaculate One's roar... We must destroy those golems, and quickly!

boss.speaker: The Immaculate One
boss.line: I see the years have not cured humanity of its folly... You still wish to hurt and betray my mother and myself!

boss.speaker: The Immaculate One
boss.line: Give her back... Give back my mother! Gaaaaaah!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: So it's true. You don't value human life at all. Isn't that right, Immaculate One?

boss.speaker: The Immaculate One
boss.line: Nonsense! Fools who do not accept their own sins are undeserving of salvation! You humans are the ones who betrayed! You betrayed me, and you betrayed my mother!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: I did not betray you or her. I never believed in you from the beginning.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: When humanity stands strong and people reach out for each other...there's no need for gods. Rhea. Your reign of tyranny is over.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: I'm ending this once and for all!

narration: A rising flame was alight as the flow of time carved a new history for Fódlan. With the fall of Fhirdiad, the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus and the Church of Seiros both vanished into the people's memories. Fódlan was finally one unified nation, under the rule of Emperor Edelgard and the Adrestian Empire. Embracing her newfound power, Edelgard could at last set about destroying Fódlan's entrenched system of nobility and rebuild a world free from the tyranny of Crests and status. Yet beneath the surface, an unseen and silent struggle began to take shape. From her seat of power, Edelgard could at last wage war on those who slither in the dark.
